channel.title: A way to stop flash games being played locally
channel.description: Well at work we have a constant issue with people playing flash games locally on the machine, last year i was on the other side playing the games and now i've got to help prevent it. We've blocked all web flash applications and have got a whitelist setup for that so that certain websites with flash can still be used. But does anyone here know how to stop flash games being played locally? We need to keep flash player on there because one of IT units revolves around making a flash presentation but not flash games. So any ideas?

item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

[quote=“bowserjr2, post:9, topic:284612”][quote author=Unhandled link=topic=376131.msg2834623#msg2834623 date=1245544415]
Wait I thought he said this was for work?
If it is company computers and company time, you can log whatever the fuck you want.

[/quote]
Thats not right, you are not free to do whatever you want, even if there is the companies computer/time. Maybe ask someone who know more about this since I know this can be on the edge about what allowed or not.

Also, what will stop then from programming their own games in flash then playing them?
Seriously, the only way to do this would be to take a few screenshots every time a new flash process is started, then manually review them.

If you start making own games in the work-time your performance goes down and you get easy discovered so I don’t think that would be necessarily.

Anyway, what does you work as?[/quote]

I don’t know where you got the idea that employees have rights to privacy while on company computers.
A company is perfectly allowed to monitor what their employees do on company computers, they just have to inform the employees they are doing it and what data is collected.
